headline: Security Best Practices You Should Know

digest_items.title: Implement network segmentation
digest_items.why: Segmentation limits lateral movement in case of breach
digest_items.fix: Separate production, staging, and development networks with firewalls

digest_items.title: Use security headers scanner
digest_items.why: Missing security headers leave applications vulnerable to common attacks
digest_items.fix: Use securityheaders.com to scan and implement recommended headers

digest_items.title: Remove default credentials
digest_items.why: Default passwords are publicly known and exploited by automated scanners
digest_items.fix: Change all default passwords immediately after deployment

digest_items.title: Use environment variables for secrets
digest_items.why: Hardcoded secrets in code are exposed in version control
digest_items.fix: Store secrets in .env files (gitignored) or secret management services

digest_items.title: Scan dependencies for vulnerabilities
digest_items.why: Vulnerable dependencies are a common attack vector in supply chain attacks
digest_items.fix: Use tools like npm audit, pip-audit, or Snyk in your CI/CD pipeline

digest_items.title: Verify patch management process
digest_items.why: Unpatched systems are vulnerable to known exploits
digest_items.fix: Establish regular patching schedule and test updates before deployment

digest_items.title: Use security champions program
digest_items.why: Embedded security advocates improve security culture across teams
digest_items.fix: Designate security champions in each team and provide training

digest_items.title: Enable audit logging
digest_items.why: Audit logs are essential for incident response and compliance
digest_items.fix: Log authentication events, data access, and configuration changes
